meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to one million dynes per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the pressure in barras to understand the force.
meanings.sent2: The machine can withstand up to 10 barras of pressure before breaking.
meanings.sent3: The balloon popped when it reached the maximum barras on the gauge.
meanings.sent4: The barras of stress on the material caused it to bend under the weight.
meanings.sent5: The barras on the scale showed the immense force exerted on the object.

meanings.definition: A type of bread roll or loaf.
meanings.sent1: I love to have barras with butter for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells freshly baked barras every morning.
meanings.sent3: The kids enjoyed a picnic with barras and jam sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of warm barras filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The golden crust of the barras was crispy and delicious.

meanings.sent1: The gymnast practiced her routine on the barras.
meanings.sent2: The coach adjusted the height of the barras for the competition.
meanings.sent3: During practice, the gymnast slipped off the barras and landed on the mat.
meanings.sent4: Balancing on the barras requires strength and precision.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast gracefully flipped over the barras, impressing the judges.

meanings.definition: A type of currency in Spain and Portugal.
meanings.sent1: In Spain, you can pay with euros or barras at the market.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper exchanged my euros for barras at a fair rate.
meanings.sent3: The traveler was surprised by the colorful design on the barras.
meanings.sent4: The value of barras fluctuates based on the economic conditions.
meanings.sent5: The souvenir shop accepted both euros and barras for the handmade crafts.
